required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ganciclovir by Infusion and by Mouth in Treating Patients With Cytomegalovirus After Donor Bone Marrow Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Intravenous Ganciclovir Followed by Oral Ganciclovir in the Treatment of Reactivation of CMV Following Bone Marrow Transplant

brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Antiviral drugs, such as ganciclovir, act against viruses. Giving ganciclovir by infusion and then by mouth may be effective treatment for cytomegalovirus that has become active after donor bone marrow transplant.
PURPOSE: This phase II trial is studying how well giving ganciclovir by infusion and by mouth works in treating patients with cytomegalovirus after donor bone marrow transplant.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
- To determine the feasibility of using oral ganciclovir (GCV) following induction with intravenous GCV in the setting of cytomegalovirus (CMV) reactivation after bone marrow transplantation.
OUTLINE: Blood cultures for cytomegalovirus (CMV) are obtained periodically after the planned bone marrow transplantation (BMT). Patients showing reactivation of CMV receive induction ganciclovir (GCV) IV twice a day on days 1-7. Patients then receive maintenance oral GCV three times a day for 5 weeks in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Patients undergo blood collection periodically during study for pharmacokinetic studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first ganciclovir positive test, after day 21 post-hematopoietic cell transplant
primary_outcome.description: This will be measured by the number of the CMV+ participants with adverse events occurring when receiving oral GCV.

primary_outcome.measure: Observation of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) in Blood as Measured by Either Blood Culture or Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) During the Course of Antiviral Treatment
Compliance Rate Among Patients With CMV Reactivation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first ganciclovir positive test to the end of the 6th week GCV therapy
primary_outcome.description: CMV reactivation patients completed 6-week GCV therapy.

arm_group.description: Ganciclovir IV 5 mg/kg/bid x 7 days followed by Ganciclovir Oral 1000 mg tid 7 days per week x 5 weeks

intervention.description: Following the first CMV-positive blood culture on day 21 or later, or the first two consecutive CMV-positive PCR tests on day 21 or later, 5mg/kg/bid x 7 days of Ganciclovir is given intravenously, followed by oral Ganciclovir 1000 mg tid 7 days per week x 5 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:
- Undergoing allogeneic transplantation, including unrelated donor bone marrow transplantation (BMT) and/or allogeneic donor leukocyte infusion, for any indication
- Patients or their donors must have had a positive pre-BMT cytomegalovirus (CMV) antibody titer as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA)
PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:
- Able to comply with study requirements
Exclusion criteria:
- Signs or symptoms of documented CMV infection, including any positive CMV culture from any site and/or any suspected or documented CMV-associated clinical syndrome, at the time of study entry
- History of symptomatic CMV-associated clinical syndrome
PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:
- Receiving concurrent investigational antiviral agents
PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:
- History of hypersensitivity to ganciclovir or acyclovir

overall_official.affiliation: City of Hope Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: City of Hope National Medical Center

reference.citation: R. Spielberger, J. Zaia, R. A. Nelson, E. Newman, G. Gallez-Hawkins, A. Ahlers, J. Stevenson, C. Acedo, A. Alam, R. Bhatia, S. Cohen, P. Falk, H. Fung, A.Kashyap, N. Kogut, Al Krishnan, A. Molina, A. Nademanee, M. O'Donnell, P. Parker, L. Popplewell, R. Rodriguez, F. Sahebi, D. Snyder, A. Stein, S. Forman. Use of Oral Ganciclovir (PO-GCV) for the Preemptive Treatment (Tx) of CMV Following Allogeneic HCT: Safety and Feasibility Results. Blood 96 (11): 586A # 2516, 2000.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients undergo intervention with intravenous ganciclovir followed by oral ganciclovir, if cytomegalovirus reactivation is detected.

baseline.population: All patients start out in the "No CMV Reactivation" period, at least until day 21 when the first blood culture or PCR tests are performed. After one positive blood culture or two consecutive positive PCR tests, patients move to the "CMV Reactivation Detected" period. Tests are performed twice weekly from day 21 post-transplant to day 100.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Blood Culture at Day 21 or later -or- PCR Test at Day 21 or later

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: This will be measured by the number of the CMV+ participants with adverse events occurring when receiving oral GCV.
outcome.time_frame: From first ganciclovir positive test, after day 21 post-hematopoietic cell transplant
outcome.population: Patients are treated with Intravenous Ganciclovir followed by Oral Ganciclovir on detection of CMV reactivation. Among the 36 patients with CMV reactivation, four patients' adverse event data are not available.

group.title: CMV Reactivation Patients With GCV
group.description: CMV reactivation patients with intravenous Ganciclovir followed by oral Ganciclovir.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
measure.description: This will be measured by the number of the CMV+ participants with adverse events occurring when receiving oral GCV.
measure.population: Patients are treated with Intravenous Ganciclovir followed by Oral Ganciclovir on detection of CMV reactivation. Among the 36 patients with CMV reactivation, four patients' adverse event data are not available.

class.title: Hematuria (in the absence of vaginal bleeding)
Muscle weakness, generalized or specific area

outcome.title: Observation of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) in Blood as Measured by Either Blood Culture or Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) During the Course of Antiviral Treatment

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Blood Culture at Day 21 or later -or- PCR Test at Day 21 or later

measure.title: Observation of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) in Blood as Measured by Either Blood Culture or Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) During the Course of Antiviral Treatment

outcome.title: Compliance Rate Among Patients With CMV Reactivation
outcome.description: CMV reactivation patients completed 6-week GCV therapy.
outcome.time_frame: From first ganciclovir positive test to the end of the 6th week GCV therapy
outcome.population: Among the 36 patients with CMV reactivation, two patients are in-evaluable for compliance.

group.title: Compliance Among Patients With CMV Reactivation
group.description: Patients with CMV reactivation detected by blood culture or PCR test.

measure.title: Compliance Rate Among Patients With CMV Reactivation
measure.description: CMV reactivation patients completed 6-week GCV therapy.
measure.population: Among the 36 patients with CMV reactivation, two patients are in-evaluable for compliance.

reported_events.time_frame: Death was monitored from Day 0 up to Year 11. Serious and other adverse events were assessed from Day 21 up to Day 100.
reported_events.desc: Death was monitored for all participants. Adverse events were assessed for the CMV+ participants, who were treated with intravenous Ganciclovir followed by oral Ganciclovir on detection of CMV reactivation. Among the 36 patients with CMV reactivation, four patients' adverse event data are not available.

group.title: Patients With CMV Reactivation Detected
group.description: CMV Positive Blood Culture at Day 21 or later -or- CMV Positive PCR Test at Day 21 or later

group.title: Patients Without CMV Reactivation Detected
group.description: No CMV Positive Blood Culture at Day 21 or later -and- No CMV Positive PCR Test at Day 21 or later

event.sub_title: INR (International Normalized Ratio of prothrombin time)
Hematuria (in the absence of vaginal bleeding)
Bilirubin associated with graft versus host disease (GVHD)
Muscle weakness, generalized or specific area (not due to neuropathy)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
